intro: Chorizanthe thurberi var. macrotheca, commonly known as Thurber's choris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping to reduce water loss. The flowers, which are often pink or red, bloom in late summer and attract various pollinators.
